author: A D
text:
Two staff members of Sri Arunachaleswarar Temple have been suspended for negligence in ensuring the safety of devotees at the Mahodaya Punyakala Theerthavaari, where four devotees drowned on Monday.

Temple festival Amina Annamalai and Maniyakarar Nagamani have been suspended owing to poor arrangements.

Joint Commissioner Thakkar of the Temple R.Senthil Velan was relieved from the post. P.Vasunathan, Joint Commissioner, HR&CE, Villupuram Region, has been given additional charge of the temple.

The tragedy occurred due to the absence of hand rails/ barricades in the steps of the pond, Fire and Rescue Services personnel during the festival, insufficient number of police personnel to control the crowd and lack of lifesaving equipment.

“Even the district administration was not informed of the festival of this magnitude. No meeting was conducted to discuss crowd management at the festival. These things are to be done by higher officials. The duty of the amina was to only to safeguard the deity in the processions,” temple employees said.
title: Day after tragedy, two temple staff suspended
